Description: Porphyry bowl: small bowl with flat base, composed of mottled black and white porphyry. The sides are slightly concave near the base and convex above, turning inwards at the top to a plain rim. The exterior of the bowl bears an incised inscription of unknown reading.
Curator's comments: For parallels to this inscription, see W. M. F. Petrie, 'Funeral Furniture with Stone and Metal Vases' (London, 1937), 6-7 and pl. XVI, 212-19.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
